column4: is there a screensaver in ubuntu which shows a picture of an actual satellite and cloud formations?
i looked at the cosmos dataset but it didnt have one with a picture of an actual satellite
there's a screensaver in there that you can tell to show your own choice of picture, I've forggent exactly which one it is though
i was wondering if someone put a screenshot there
You need the 3d drivers for ati that are part of easyubuntu
With those google earth and ATI are fine
no, I need nvidia, which I have :)
that is a wishful thing, but do you realize how much that might cost!!
it's under internet in the menu
For a company like google, not much
if you didn't request it during the install, use alacarte to modify the menu
more often than not, yes
it says command not found
what is the file, where is it, and is it executable? (the big three questions)
try ~/google-earth/googleearth
bingo!
ok now how do i install an icon for this
and just a note: three lines of paste is the max :)
i want to add it in the internet section
Applications->Alacarte , add a menu entry with that
try killall gnome-panel first
bingo
thanks :) that solved everything
